So, to be fair the place itself was very neat. The beds were comfy, and the host was very helpful and communicative. I wrestled between giving this place 4 stars but ultimately settled on 3 for the following reasons:
1) I reserved what was marketed on the app as an “entire place”. Now, I’m sure technically it might count but in truth, it was a garage that had been remodeled into an apartment space. While it did have a little kitchenette, and a restroom of its own (aka I didn’t share a space with the family of the attached house) it did have a wall that connected with the home. So it felt more like a private room than an entire place to myself. It was a bit odd to pull up to a home with cars in the driveway and realize that this was basically a detached area semi connected to the house. So I’m not sure if that’s something I missed on my end or not, but definitely wouldn’t recommend if you’re looking for an entire place to yourself.
2) The heater didn’t work and it dipped into the 40s at night.
3) There are a lot of dogs in the neighborhood and anytime someone was outside they would go crazy barking. Woke me up a few times throughout the night.
Again, to be fair the host was awesome and the space was nice. Just not what I thought it was.
